bill_title: require each school board to establish a policy on the use of certain school district facilities by transgender persons.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require each school board to establish a policy on the use of certain school district facilities by transgender persons. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-8 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The school board of each public school district in the state shall establish and make available to the public a policy regarding the use of the bathrooms and locker rooms located in schools within the school district by any transgender person. For the purposes of this Act, a transgender person is a person whose gender identity does not match the person's biological sex assigned at birth. The person's biological sex is the physical condition of being male or female as determined by the person's chromosomes and anatomy as identified at birth. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.167 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
